fields.request: Manual QA: Confirm start skips deprecated prestart environment refresh
fields.request_details:
1. Record the service name from `cat locks/service.lck` on a systemd node.
2. Inspect `/etc/systemd/system/${SERVICE}.service` and confirm there is no `ExecStartPre=${BASE_DIR}/scripts/prestart-refresh.sh` entry (also check any `celery-*` or `lcd-*` units if present).
3. Note the current modification time for `logs/env-refresh.sh.log` (if it exists).
4. Run `./start.sh` and wait for the service to report active.
5. Verify `logs/env-refresh.sh.log` retains the earlier timestamp and that `sudo journalctl -u ${SERVICE} -n 20` does not include `prestart-refresh.sh` entries.
6. Confirm `./status.sh` reports the suite healthy after the start and repeat the check for Celery or LCD services when enabled.
